Key Match Events: The Pirates blew a seven-run lead in the final three innings
Christian Bethancourt lined an 0-1 fastball that shortstop Isiah Kiner-Falefa could only get a piece of before it trickled into left field to put Chicago ahead, 11-10
Jalen Beeks would get the final out of the inning but not before allowing the two inherited runners to score, along with a run charged to himself
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Derek Shelton emphasized the importance of executing at the end of games
Paul Skenes mentioned that the team needs to get back to their identity as a team and play for each other
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Derek Shelton expressed frustration with the team's performance, stating that he's never been as upset as he is now
Bryan Reynolds mentioned that the team needs to stick together and have each other's backs
Connor Joe suggested that the team needs to stick together and play for each other
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loss was the Pirates' biggest blown lead since 2011
August has been a brutal month for the Pirates, with a 7-18 record
The Pirates have lost by one run eight times in August and blown a league-high seven saves
Others: The Pirates had a 10-3 lead through six innings before the Cubs came back to win
Closer David Bednar allowed one run and loaded the bases in the ninth inning before being relieved
The Pirates' bullpen struggled in the final three innings, allowing 11 runs
